name: Goin' Down The Road Feelin' Bad

performances.description: Rockin' version.  Get up and get some
Beautiful and inspired

performances.venue: The Austin Municipal Auditorium Austin, TX
performances.description: This NFA>GDTRFB segment is one of my favorites.  Beautiful mid sandy jam - check it out!
Funky with a huge climax, Jerry really rocking out!

performances.venue: Adams Field House, U of Montana Missoula, MT
performances.description: The NFA>GDTRFB is quite nice indeed.  Great night in Missoula!
Definitive Version

performances.venue: Alpine Valley Music Theatre East Troy, WI
Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: One of the best ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Can't believe the heads are sleeping on this one. 8 1/2 mins of nectar after NFA
From one of the greatest shows ever, a bring the house down killer. Keith w/perfect piano exc. point!
Fast groovin'
My favorite performance of the song - pretty much flawless.
3 excellent Garcia solos, instead of the usuall 2. A perfect way to close out this legendary 2nd set!
Really solid version from the Europe '72. Quintessential Dead in their prime. Nothing but good things to say about this one.

performances.venue: Great American Music Hall San Francisco, CA
performances.description: A beautiful segue from the rare gem sage and spirit. Epic One From the Vault Performance.

performances.venue: Lindley Meadows, Golden Gate Park San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Shorter funky version. Great vocal energy
3/25/1990 = best GDTRFB ever end of story. Guitar solo and energy mainlined from Heavan to Jerry's fingers. Def is Better than 10/18/1974 Winterland.
This is and epic NFA>GDTRFB>NFA to close the first set!  Best combo of the tour!

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: out of space
Show is all highlights, and NFA-GDRFB-NFA caps it in style. Listen to the whole set for full effect and feel the love.
This one absolutely cooks out of Nobody's fault.  Off Road Trips.

performances.venue: Onondaga County War Memorial Syracuse, NY
performances.description: Always been one of my favorites.  I like the first set closer spot.  Amazing Let it grow right before it, too.
Good stuff here.
Scarlet > GDTRFB. Catches the crowd by surprise for a moment. Hot version.
Outrageous 3rd Set madness with the Allman Bros, inside an amazing NFA.

performances.venue: San Antonio Civic Auditorium San Antonio, TX
performances.description: See Jerry. See Jerry shred. Shred, Jerry, shred.
Keith is high in the mix and it's just brilliant.  The NFA was a bit sloppy, but they nail the GDTRFB and the outro.
incredible NFA>GDTRFB>NFA

performances.venue: Dean Smith Center Chapel Hill, NC
Oklahoma City Music Hall Oklahoma City, OK
performances.description: "It is a crime to let a SUCKER keep his money...."

performances.venue: Yale Bowl, Yale University New Haven, CT
performances.description: A great vesion from ’71 with a unique Darkness Darkness transition jam after the “We bid you Goodnight” coda.  Very deep, spiritual interplay.
Killer version!
Great version of a tune that was played so well all tour!

performances.venue: St. Paul Auditorium St. Paul, MN
performances.description: Lots of energy, they're basically yelling the chorus at the end.
Grew up on this Skull and Roses version. Got to love the Quintessential Quartet!
Damn good
This set is an emotional roller coaster, and this Goin' Down the Road is a sweet way to continue it. Keith shines, as he does all show.

performances.venue: Boise Pavilion - Boise State University Boise, ID
performances.description: Great up-tempo groove sick solo by Jerry
With TC sitting in on the DS > Stephen > NFA > GDTRFB > NFA from Ladies and Gentlemen. excellent
This one smokes - they work up a major head of steam here. Big Phil in the mix.
Nice mellow version. It had become somewhat rare in 78-79 so I'm surprised this isn't listed. Give it a listen.
Smooth, beautiful
this one has some power behind it
On this day in history, perfection was acheived during the playing and recording of GDTRFB.
Just an awesome version!
Awesome
Another great vesion from ’71 with a unique transition jam after the “We bid you Goodnight” coda, this time into JBG.
China Cat Jam > GDTRFB - pure breakneck beauty
Great Year, Great Tour, Great Show, Great Song. Tight as fuck version following a china cat tease.
Maybe the best from E72.

performances.venue: Soldiers' and Sailors' Memorial Hall Kansas City, KS
performances.description: Funky and FAST!
Without a doubt one of the punchiest of the '90s. How can this not be up here!?!
Popping with energy.  Allmans infused awesomeness
Smokin' version aside from the cool sequence of GDTRFB>NFA>Bo Diddley>NFA.  Def worth a listen.

performances.venue: Santa Rosa Fairgrounds Santa Rosa, CA
performances.description: NFA->GDTRFB->Darkness,Darkness Jam->St. Stephen Jam->Not Fade Away Silly sick jam

performances.venue: Felt Forum, Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Good time Boogaloo...tight with Billy the Kidd workn' that kit.

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: All cylinders firing here.
From blisteringly hot, into a sweet-and-light outro > OMSN, turning on a dime.  Great fun.
Jerry hitting some real high notes. They just go crazy in this one!!!
Almost beyond description. The last full jam leading into the GDTR chorus is a perfect storm example of what made the Dead magic
Awesome NFA>GDTRFB.  Cipollina sitting in.  I love this road trips...can't believe noone has heard this.

performances.venue: Iowa State Fairgrounds Des Moines, IA
performances.description: Heady version at this epic show!  Just a great vibe with theb whole show!
ENCORE: The only true stand alone GDTRFB. All others flow into or out of something else even the other encore versions

performances.venue: San Diego International Sports Arena San Diego, CA
performances.description: Wow, thought for sure this was going to have at least 5 votes. Killer GDTRFD->OMSN, Great SBD too!
Roadhouse Boogaloo'in
Some serious surf rock here, the likes of which only found in '74

performances.venue: Cumberland County Civic Center Portland, ME
performances.description: Mother's Day Dead, One of the best GDTR from the early 80's, Weir is just thrashing chords during the second jam, check it out
Smooth and joyful
Just transcendentally perfect. The whole set from Cryptical on is monumental '71 headiness.
One of my favorite renditions. Crazy, psychedelic, and propulsive. 1988!!
NFA>GDTRFB>NFA is pure joy
Great end to the show, and splits Sugar Mag/Sunshine Daydream.

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: Smokin'

performances.venue: Folsom Field, University of Colorado Boulder, CO
performances.description: The entire stadium of heads got their speeding ticket punched by the gang on this one.
hot and tight version after a groovy NFA, surprised it's not up here yet

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: unbelievable music coming out of space!

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: this one is HOT!

performances.venue: Autzen Stadium, U. of Oregon Eugene, OR
performances.description: doesnt get hotter
Flurry of activity.  Bob and Jerry are screaming their lungs out at the end of this one

performances.venue: Terminal Island Correctional Facility San Pedro, CA
performances.description: Another great version from 1971.  Love all the NFA>GDRFB from 71.
Sweet sweet version at this overlooked show!
Intense. The whole second set is unreal.
Unique jam going into the song and we get a mountan jam tease into the NFA reprise. Overall a killer version.

performances.venue: Marin County Veterans Auditorium San Rafael, CA
performances.description: Steps out unexpectedly from an almost-aborted Miracle. Tight and right jamming.
This is a lightening fast bowl of nose clams, played 100x the speed of hyperspace.  Worth it just to hear how fast the boys ventured to take this on
Once this gets warmed up Phil's flipflop picking, Jer's firing up the neck, Bob's screamin' like a chick and Brent's hopping on his B3.
A bitchin' ride....sounds like they run right over Donna.
Don't shut off the after the LIG>DitS>CC! This version just keeps on giving - great jam all 'round.
This is an all-timer, I say...Garcia plays like a trumpet here, pre-midi...
Seamless NFA transitions, and a goosebump-inducing Goin Down
Idk about the rest of the show but ol jerr is certainly feelin it on this one..tears it up on the end solo!
Exhuberent and triumphant.  Closes out one hellofa 2nd set and kicks like a rocket.
best lead you've ever heard on this song!
Subtle and musical, slithers its way into an epic Lovelight.  Nicely different from others of the era, no NFA sandwich.
Seriously scorching Estimated >GDTR, in this combo BOTH songs are played to "best ever" heights
Wonderful pre drums placement loads of jamming on this dedicated to Laura?
Kinda of a juke joint vibe - playing around with the arrangement a bit.
Slightly different sound and feel, Part of a Hot Scarlet Begonias->Eyes of the World->Goin Down The Road Feelin Bad triplet. HOT show
This is a great one, and on youtube for the curious.

performances.venue: Northrop Auditorium, U. of Minn. Minneapolis, MN
performances.description: NFA>Hits overdrive at the 2:00 mark first show with Keith this one's tasty, nice cool down to  >NFA

performances.venue: Barton Hall - Cornell University Ithaca, NY
performances.description: High energy version that is part of an epic post drums.
Smoked out of space.  Some fanning for good measure, too.
Rises, catches the wind, and soars '76 style
box>gdtrfb out of space
Amazing guitar playing
Brent howls on this one.  What a fun night this must have been.
In a show overshadowed by its neighbors, this one stands out for coming together just brilliantly.  Show needs more love.
absolute wonderful rocking version, another excellent version from 1971
More '71 style jams here - nice workout.
Easy going ...
Easy going ...
Note for note perfection. Now this is a "heady version". My favorite GDTRFB
Nice EARLY set II version (did that happen much?). Bid You Goodnight at the end is cool into Drums.

performances.venue: Campus Stadium - University Of California Santa Barbara, CA
performances.description: Strike match light fuse and watch it burn - hootn' & hollerin is a happenin.
Cooks hot.
Kicks ass for '85...Bobby fuzzed out behind Jerry's piercing the acid bubble. Saw this and forgot how good it was...happens hahahah
One of the rare versions that stands apart with or without its NFA bread.
Great Jerry intro, killer pre-drums placement.

performances.venue: St. Paul Civic Center St. Paul, MN
performances.description: Jerry got some serious boogie goin' on. How did this gem escape our attention for so long?
This is a great version from a great show.

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: the gdtrfb's in the 90's were hard to come by and only showed up at killer shows; this is more of the same
Unique, as it goes into a very brief 'Mountain Jam' sounding jam before heading back into NFA.  Pretty hot version

performances.venue: Assembly Hall, University of Illinois Champaign-Urbana, IL
performances.description: A great way to cap off this amazing show!
Phil is on fire this show the song speaks for itself!!!
Out of a great NFA, this Going Down the Road rocks, Weir is strumming chords like a madman and Phil drops a few bombs for good measure, give it a try.
Awesome in pre-drums slot
One of the tightest and best jams I've ever heard.  Absolute magic.  Goes straight into a killer Lovelight.  This is an amazing show.  Check it out.
Heard this last night on the XM Dead Channel. Just classic high energy rock n roll!
Beautiful, a classic '74 rendition that gets overshadowed by the monster china>rider
A tremendous version that is first killed by Bruce and then Jer one ups him!
GDTRFB --> JBG !!!
~13 minute wacky jam coming out of this and then going into drums.  The energy is wild, Jerry is tearing it up and Phil sounds great on the aud
Lots of good vibes coming from this one, Jerry is smooth as ever.
Wild, anarchic jam before the transition the transition back to NFA, replete with Jerry harmonics and Phil bombs.
Hard rockin' Bruce era version.
Hot

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York, NY
performances.description: A rockin' GDTRFB sandwiched b/w two insane NFAs! Every show the dead played in 72 seemed to be another level!
ROCK AND ROLL!
Jer's b-day.  Sweet jamming version with great vocals, in spite/because of what sounds like a cold/sore throat.  Brilliant show all around.
Smokin' hot version
I've commented earlier on the NFA portion of this sandy, but this GDTRFB is a considerably meaty portion as well!  Very hot ish
Builds nicely and the ending jam has a certain swagger to it.

performances.venue: Davis Gym, Bucknell University Lewisburg, PA
performances.description: Bucknell University
Give it a listen.

performances.venue: Wallace Wade Stadium, Duke University Durham, NC
performances.description: A standout performance from an absolutely standout show

performances.venue: Felt Forum - Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: AWESOME in the pocket jammin here - NFA>GDTRFB>NFA - '71 was the kind for these!
Been getting teased with this coming out of space all tour. Doesn't come out of space but it still burns

performances.venue: Academy of Music New York City, NY
performances.description: They push the energy up and up and up.  Special transition into OMSN. An all-round high voltage jamming show. Underrated.

performances.venue: Greek Theater - University of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Solid 88 version, can't go wrong with the Greek.

performances.venue: Fillmore East New York City, NY
performances.description: Get the miller.105815

performances.venue: Radio City Music Hall New York, NY
performances.description: Coked up! Amazing version, especially if you like the heat
You will find this is special. Hillbilly Jer with Bobby on slide - sweet action all the way around.
Awesome version from a tiny show
And the mix goes to Phil!
This Gem Trails behind the Strage ToG>Estimated>eyes>Drums/Keys>Maybe You Know>GDTRFB, what a trip
Notable for a 6-min opening jam that comes out of Wharf Rat, very cool, mislabeled "Drums". The GDTRFB smokes too.
Has a little bit of everything.
Splendid set closer with delightfully boisterous contributions from Keith and a permeating feeling of real joy.
One of those “surprised not to see this here” moments. A short, less soaring one than many this period, but fun nonetheless

performances.venue: Sam Boyd Silver Bowl Las Vegas, NV
performances.description: might be the highlight of this show
this show is off the hook, goin down the road out of space is so nice
Jumping version capping off a blazingly great show. With a nice mellow outro, too.  The crowd and the boys just seem so full of joy and love.

performances.venue: Campus Stadium, UCSB Santa Barbara, CA
performances.description: Great energy
Hard rockin' early '81 muscle & passion
slowly segues out of throwing stones like a match made in Heaven and kicks into overdrive, leaving you gasping for more
Nice treat!
The transition jam back to NFA is one of the trippiest, dreamy, paintbrushes of sound ones I know.

performances.venue: McDonough Arena - Georgetown University Washington, DC
performances.description: Ripping version from the greatest year of them all.
Fun One!

performances.venue: Henry J. Kaiser Convention Center Oakland, CA
performances.description: Out of Eyes> Sweet Energy for '85 here - The boys bring some speed and Jer BELTS out the vocals. Awesome and Fun.
Cool one here with a bunch of twist and turns in Jer's bag of riffs.

performances.venue: Moscone Convention Center San Francisco, CA
performances.description: Finely jammed with seatbelts off..

performances.venue: The Palestra, U. of Rochester Rochester, NY
performances.description: Beautiful jam here, with some great Jerry fuzztone soloing.
Excellent technically proficient high energy version
Final time played, out of a 26 minute Space!!!

performances.venue: Silva Hall, Hult Center Eugene, OR
performances.description: Attacked with precision and exuberance by the ensemble, who bat this one on down the road in viscous and youthful ’83 style.
Another great 1972 version of this rockin' tune.
The second instrumental break, Jerry goes nutzoid, cranking it up higher and higher. A must hear version.
Amazing that this song from this year hasn't been posted yet.
Love the restraint Jerry plays with during the second instrumental break. Very measured and disciplined.
Phil just motorboatin his ass all over this one -  excellent AWBYGN trasnition to the NFA screamer
Jerry goes liquid over the top at 4:37. Whole band on board with urgency on this one.
Segues gorgeously out of a raggedly beautiful Stella.  Set closer.
Hot version at the end of a smoking sequence
Comin' outta outer space, stickin' the landing on the runway. Fast, and groovin' solid 80s version.
Worth a listen, Jerry noodles around with Cumberland Blues before > to drums.
Rousing! 72's got many of the best/ favorites
Crackling with energy, just like the rest of the night from the beautiful Auditorium Theatre
“Don’t wanna be beaten this old way…” Shorter, with just a single solo, but extremely powerful performance that could have been on Skull N Roses
High, high energy NFA>GDTRFB>NFA really worth checking out, absolutley rockin' version

performances.venue: Santa Fe Downs Santa Fe, NM
performances.description: Super high energy Throwing Stones>GDTRB
Contains everything and could stand alone as an epic GDTRFB, even as part of its trad NFA sammy. Great speed work from everyone, builds and builds.
This is absolutely delicious, such a truly incredible version, the guests add a lot of energy
Sparks fly and smoke billows maximum overdrive is achieved ...sneaky good one here.
Extremely high energy spirited rendition. Wonderful NYE show, a welcome back celebration.
TREMENDOUS version sizzling hot
Possibly the highest energy piece in the whole show. An excellent jam that left the crowd smiling, for certain.

performances.venue: Carrier Dome, Syracuse U Syracuse, NY
performances.description: Speedy. Love that lonesome prarie boogie!!!

performances.venue: Cumberland County Civic Center Portland, ME
performances.description: Dig that lonesome prarie boogie. Fast, focused, tight.
Love the way Jerry changes and is charge of the tempo.
Nice boogie coming out of Space.

performances.venue: Kansas City Municipal Auditorium Arena Kansas City, MO
performances.description: Comin' out of Truckin', some nice peaks
Groovy, kicked back rendition. Jerry’s is ripping the vocals in this one
Comes out of a wild Other One and leads into a powerful Wharf Rat
Very substantial jam develops out of the AWBYGN passage before the return to NFA.

performances.venue: Greek Theatre - University of California Berkeley, CA
Rochester Community War Memorial Rochester, NY
performances.description: Nice mellow version
assured fireside lip-smacker. Tremendously pocketed stolen along, drawing the wanderer's mud-bogging sketches in moonlit bluegrass wistful song

performances.venue: Greek Theatre - University of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: refined and elegant. calm splendor for the cali regular heads

performances.venue: School Gymnasium, S.U.N.Y. Stony Brook, NY
performances.description: Raw early version, the jamming in the final :30 hints at the song's potential, which twould be realized the following weekend in Port Chester.
Right before a fantastic caution
Smokey brew from the eye of ‘74
Wow- Garcia and the band really go for it here

performances.venue: St. Paul Civic Center St. Paul, MN
performances.description: They’re all on fire, but Brent and Jerry are molten hot. Not bad.

performances.venue: Brendan Byrne Arena East Rutherford, NJ
performances.description: tight, strong GDTR with excellent vocal  interplay between Jerry and Brent
Jerry plays away his sorrows on top of the rhythm devil’s swinging beats. Sweet as can be with some real magical energy here.
up, up, and away!
